title: Manipuri Guy Found WhatsApp Bug, Facebook Rewarded Him With $5000 & Hall Of Fame Mention
text:
We are getting so dependent on online services like Facebook, WhatsApp, Google and others, we need to ensure they are safe and secure for our own benefit.

A 22-year-old civil engineer from Manipur, Zonel Sougaijam is a superhero who doesn't wear a cape, because he just alerted WhatsApp about a security hole and got rewarded for his effort.

Zonel Sougaijam

According to a PTI report, Facebook has honoured and rewarded the Manipuri guy for coming across a WhatsApp bug that could've violated any user's privacy -- definitely a nightmare averted.

How did Sougaijam help make WhatsApp -- which has over 22 crore active users in India -- safer? Similar to the Kerala student, he found a bug during a WhatsApp voice call, which would allow caller to switch to video call without alerting the receiver.

Don't Miss 2.2 K SHARES

This bug obviously could've have caused huge privacy violation of millions of WhatsApp users, that's why Facebook (WhatsApp's parent company) decided to celebrate Sougaijam's alertness.

Reuters

Facebook awarded Zonel Sougaijam US $5000 or Rs 3.5 lakh for his investigative work, and also honoured him by including him his name in their Hall of Fame for white hackers. He is currently 16th on that list.

The Manipuri whitehack said that after he emailed his report to the Facebook Security team, they acknowledged it the very next and fixed the critical WhatsApp bug within three weeks.
description: We all know that Facebook and WhatsApp run bug bountry programs, where if security researchers alert them of a critical hole, they get rewarded with money and a mention in their Hall of Fame. A Manipuri guy managed to do just that, by alerting WhatsApp of a security bug and getting rewarded.
